      20                 :            :   {
      21                 :            :     public:
      22                 :            :       Mesh2dm( size_t faceVerticesMaximumCount,
      23                 :            :                const std::string &uri,
      24                 :            :                const std::map<size_t, size_t> vertexIDtoIndex
      25                 :            :              );

      27                 :            : 
      28                 :            : 
      29                 :            :       //! HYDRO_AS-2D supports gaps in the vertex indexing,
      30                 :            :       //! but we use continuos array of vertices in MDAL
      31                 :            :       //! \param vertexID internal index/ID of the vertex that native format uses
      32                 :            :       //! \returns index of the vertex in the continuous array of vertices we returned by readVertices().
      33                 :            :       //!          For invalid vertexID it is returned index that is out of vertices array bounds.
      34                 :            :       virtual size_t vertexIndex( size_t vertexID ) const;
      35                 :            : 
      36                 :            :       //! Returns maximum vertex ID.
      37                 :            :       //! For meshes without gaps in vertex indexing, it is vertex count - 1
      38                 :            :       virtual size_t maximumVertexId() const;
      39                 :            : 
      40                 :            :     private:
      41                 :            :       //! 2dm supports "gaps" in the mesh indexing
      42                 :            :       //! Store only the indices that have different index and ID
      43                 :            :       //! https://github.com/lutraconsulting/MDAL/issues/51
      44                 :            :       std::map<size_t, size_t> mVertexIDtoIndex;
      45                 :            :   };
      46                 :            : 
      47                 :            :   /**
      48                 :            :    * 2DM format specification used in TUFLOW, HYDRO_AS-2D and BASEMENET solvers
      49                 :            :    * Text file format representing mesh vertices (ND) and faces (E**)
      50                 :            :    * ND id x y z
      51                 :            :    * The format supports lines, triangles and quads, where the elememts could be
      52                 :            :    * stored with some intermediate points (e.g. triangle defined by 6 vertices, vertices
      53                 :            :    * and the middle of the edges) We do support only simple definition, so E6T, E8Q and E9Q
      54                 :            :    * are not supported.
      55                 :            :    * E3T id 1 2 3 mat_id -> face type, id, vertex indices ..., material index
      56                 :            :    *
      57                 :            :    * full specification here: https://www.xmswiki.com/wiki/SMS:2D_Mesh_Files_*.2dm
      58                 :            :    *
      59                 :            :    * This will process as many material IDs as promised by the NUM_MATERIALS_PER_ELEM tag and add them as face
      60                 :            :    * dataset groups. The naming for these groups is "Material ID" for the first, "Bed Elevation (Face)" for the
      61                 :            :    * second, and finally "Auxiliary Material ID <X>" for any subsequent materials, X being a counter to ensure
      62                 :            :    * unique group names:
      63                 :            :    * E** id 1 2 3 [Material ID] [Bed Elevation (Face)] [Auxiliary Material ID 1] [Auxiliary Material ID 2] ...
      64                 :            :    * If the NUM_MATERIALS_PER_ELEM tag is not provided, a fallback mode is used that will only check for the
      65                 :            :    * second MATID column and add it under the name "Bed Elevation (Face)" if found.
      66                 :            :    * Noe that this is purely a compatibility mode for BASEMENT 3.x releases; NUM_MATERIALS_... is a required
      67                 :            :    * tag according to the 2DM specification.
      68                 :            :    *
      69                 :            :    * Note that some 2dm formats do have some extra columns after mat_id column with
      70                 :            :    * data with unknown origin/name (e.g. tests/data/2dm/regular_grid.2dm)
      71                 :            :    *
      72                 :            :    * HYDRO_AS-2D also allows gaps in vertex indexing. In this case we support only files
      73                 :            :    * where the vertices are sorted by ID in the source file (limitation of the implementation)
      74                 :            :    *
      75                 :            :    * Vertex/Face IDs should be indexed from 1. We support indexing from 0 for datasets in xmdf format,
      76                 :            :    * but not for ascii dat format (since the loop is from 0 to maximumVertexId() which is in this case
      77                 :            :    * numberical_limits<size_t>::max(); (limitation of the implementation)
      78                 :            :    */
      79                 :            :   class Driver2dm: public Driver
      80                 :            :   {
      81                 :            :     public:
      82                 :            :       Driver2dm();
      83                 :            :       ~Driver2dm() override;
      84                 :            :       Driver2dm *create() override;
      85                 :            : 
      86                 :          0 :       int faceVerticesMaximumCount() const override {return 6;}
      87                 :            : 
      88                 :            :       bool canReadMesh( const std::string &uri ) override;
      89                 :            :       std::unique_ptr< Mesh > load( const std::string &meshFile, const std::string &meshName = "" ) override;
      90                 :            :       void save( const std::string &fileName, const std::string &, Mesh *mesh ) override;
      91                 :            :
